title: Cat. 58  Pitcher, 1878
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Design attributed to Edward C. Moore (American, 1827–1891)  
Tiffany & Co. (American, founded 1837)  
New York, New York  
Silver, gold, and copper; 20.3 × 12.7 × 15.2 cm (8 7/8 × 5 1/4 × 6 7/8 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of Mrs. Frank Sulzberger, 1984.240

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 58.1)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">By descent to Mrs. Murray M. Horowitz.

To Murray M. Horowitz, Neponsit, NY, by 1984.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1984.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Barter et al. (1998), pp. 248–50, cat. 120.

</section><section id="figures">Pitcher, 1878.

fig. 58.1 </section>
